item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

Let me get this straight: You use another jar file with all the space and resources it takes up instead of 3 lines of java?

private static Date date = new Date();
public static void log(String type, String message) {
date.setTime(System.currentTimeMillis());
System.out.println(String.format("%tT %20s : %s", date,("[" + type + “]”) ,message));
}

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Haha.

static { LOGGER.setLevel(Level.ALL); for(Handler h : LOGGER.getParent().getHandlers()) { h.setLevel(Level.ALL); h.setFormatter(new Formatter() { public String format(LogRecord record) { Level l = record.getLevel(); return new SimpleDateFormat("HHmm.ssaa").format(new Date(record.getMillis())) + (current != null ? " [" + current.getClass().getName() + (l.equals(Level.INFO) ? ']' : ' ' + l.getName().toLowerCase() + ']') : "") + ' ' + record.getMessage() + '\n'; } }); } }

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“semaphore, post:31, topic:164158”]White Castle gets the award for most effectively obfuscated log4j.properties.

2313.12PM - Is that Mercurial time? iirc one Mercurial day is like 176 earth days or 4224 hours. If that is the case, then I suppose 2313.12 would be PM… on Mercury.

:)[/quote]i believe he wrote his own logger

i will also ruin your joke by pointing out my assumption that it is HHMM.SS

:o

item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

i think iv worked out everything with the object uids, it seems the objectID takes up more bits, probably why they moved to type long, i havent found any new value hidden in the bits.

extract from my documentation
/*
* uid has 64 bits, this is how they are layed out
* x = xpos
* y = ypos
* i = id
* t = object type
* u = unknown/unused
* uiii iiii iiii iiii iiii iiii iiii iiii uttu uuuu uuuu uuuu uuuy yyyy yxxx xxxx
*/
you can easier get those values out with simple bitwise operations
x/y position has stayed the same, and objectType, which was always there, but i didnt notice anyone else using it (in the public releases of the bots iv seen)
its basicly a way of saying which type the object is, for example 2 is something which doesnt move, like a rock or tree.

and they havent even changed the object IDs from update 479 where i last tested it,
look at these two pictures, one is of #479, the other of #481

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

look at how the fields are used, it is easy to determine things manually

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

qauters:

I believe they removed one of the objects. I can only find 3 objects and an object array. I have it now renamed like that

iv found all 4 objects and an object array,
look for instance fields in the ground class, if you have a class type, look in that class, if it contains an instance field of type Animable, then its an Object
and there are the same number of them as before.

it seems the uid field is now of type long,
before, they used to do loads of bitshifts on uid, to get its id, position and some other stuff, then they had 32bits to mess around with, now they have 64
also it means its a piece of piss to find object.uid, its the only instance long in the object classes

i gotta do some real life stuff now, but so far i get the impression that this update has actually made it easier for us.
one thing i bet has changed, is the IDs of stuff, rocks and trees and whatever[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 17-12-2007, 22:44:20[/size][hr]heres an extract from my log about the ground, objects and UIDs

interface Ground added to qh
getGroundArray() added to "client" gets static type qh[][][] "tb.ib"
interface ObjectDefinition added to gd
getObject5Array() added to "qh" gets type gd[] "qh.H"
getUID() added to "gd" gets type long "gd.i"
interface ObjectDefinition added to wb
getObject3() added to "qh" gets type wb "qh.R"
getUID() added to "wb" gets type long "wb.b"
interface ObjectDefinition added to n
getObject2() added to "qh" gets type n "qh.S"
getUID() added to "n" gets type long "n.c"
interface ObjectDefinition added to ee
getObject1() added to "qh" gets type ee "qh.T"
getUID() added to "ee" gets type long "ee.a"
interface ObjectDefinition added to h
getObject4() added to "qh" gets type h "qh.db"
getUID() added to "h" gets type long "h.g"

it seems the order of the bits in uid has changed, the old ways of getting the id and all that other stuff doesn’t work anymore, i don’t think it will be that hard to find the new ways, but i can imagine myself later working out those annoying bitshifts in the client.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

qauters:

Also yakman only set’s a superclass and didn’t hook the actualy field.

theres other ways to get stuff instead of bytecode “hooks”,
in the canvas example, try clientAppletInstance.getComponentAt(1, 1)
(credits go to ruler for this, he told me about it when I was still young and naïve about the client)

same with event listeners i guess, aComponentInstance.getKeyListeners() or whatever, for those of you that send events that way

on the other hand, if you want epeen, it cant be that to find the only static field of type Canvas

Read full topic

Anyways, thanks yakman, your still a lifesaver.

(You learn something new everyday, don’t you :P)

item.dc:creator: @speedster239 speedster239
item.description:
@speedster239 wrote:

yakman:

[quote author=Iamadam link=topic=222916.msg1930064#msg1930064 date=1197652476]Anyway, time to stop reminiscing.

agreed, moving swiftly back on topic,

so finally go round to fixing my menu stuff, the only thing that really was wrong was that i didn’t check for the negative value, so sometimes “+ 18”, becomes “- -18”, but nothing Math.abs() cant fix

i only found those menu stuff and made transforms for them last update, so i never had a chance to see how they changed every update, thats what I’m blaming this breakage on
still have to do groundArray and all that

i noticed this though, in markMinimap()

		int i_32_ = 0x7ff & Class69.minimapInt1 + Class81.minimapInt2;
		int i_33_ = 10 + Math.max(class30.anInt587 / 2, class30.anInt703 / 2);

that part with Math.max() wasnt there last update, its used in the calculating of the final position of the minimap dot, but the method i had before still works perfectly,
i think this means some dots have a different size to others, before it just subtracted some constant values, 454 or something, now it subtracts one of those getfields divided by 2.

the method is “Class47_Sub11_Sub23.method683(int, Class30, int, int, Class47_Sub12_Sub16_Sub4, int, int)”
or “pe a (ILgf;IILfb;II)V” in an unrenamed client[/quote]

Thanks yakman :P, I was trying to work with the results from T. output for the canvas but I’m pretty sure his is broken. Anyways, thanks

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Iamadam:

Anyway, time to stop reminiscing.

agreed, moving swiftly back on topic,

so finally go round to fixing my menu stuff, the only thing that really was wrong was that i didn’t check for the negative value, so sometimes “+ 18”, becomes “- -18”, but nothing Math.abs() cant fix

i only found those menu stuff and made transforms for them last update, so i never had a chance to see how they changed every update, thats what I’m blaming this breakage on
still have to do groundArray and all that

i noticed this though, in markMinimap()

		int i_32_ = 0x7ff & Class69.minimapInt1 + Class81.minimapInt2;
		int i_33_ = 10 + Math.max(class30.anInt587 / 2, class30.anInt703 / 2);

that part with Math.max() wasnt there last update, its used in the calculating of the final position of the minimap dot, but the method i had before still works perfectly,
i think this means some dots have a different size to others, before it just subtracted some constant values, 454 or something, now it subtracts one of those getfields divided by 2.

the method is “Class47_Sub11_Sub23.method683(int, Class30, int, int, Class47_Sub12_Sub16_Sub4, int, int)”
or “pe a (ILgf;IILfb;II)V” in an unrenamed client

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Yakman, its come to that time of month has it?
Actually, we used eclipse, so batch files weren’t necessary at all. The compile-transforms target was probably from a quick test of something, and left in by mistake. We probably left the eclipse project files in some releases too.
Oh and frank_, I don’t deny that ARGA was crap. Looking through the old releases now, I can’t believe we weren’t high whilst programming it.
The newer version (which is supposedly being released one day) is a lot better, but I doubt the public will ever see it (well, from my point of view - I haven’t touched the svn for months).

Anyway, time to stop reminiscing.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

adam was the only dev who isnt a dickhead

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Iamadam:

We used ant during development. We just didn’t want to deal with a million people complaining about compiling problems, so we released the ever popular batch files.

yes i remember that, i noticed it had the target “compile-transforms” which were probably for the updater which wasnt released.

also, whatever happened to arga being about “people who want to learn and help the community, not just mindlessly leech”, someone who wanted to learn would already have ant right? or at least be willing to install it, or they could make their own batch files

also, whatever happened to arga only being using by a small number of people to stop rs being overrun by bot, you’re a bit optimistic to say that, “millions of people” would use it. [size=1pt]Hypocrite!! Or maybe the other developers had those ideas and you didnt really agree with them… oh well who knows[/size]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

frank_:

if arga werent crap it would have used ant

We used ant during development. We just didn’t want to deal with a million people complaining about compiling problems, so we released the ever popular batch files.

Read full topic

I’d post mine, but my IDEA personal license expired… Haven’t come up with the money to get another one, and I never bothered to bundle my updater, so that’s really out of the question. Oh, and I’m just too lazy to make an ant build lol.
[/quote]Err, yeah, you actually buy it?[/quote]Well yeah, someone has to. I would, but I have a perfectly legal license. Fuck yes, I own.
